20101201140029.139|20101201140030.966|TR0|
20101201140030.966|20101201140032.794|TR0|Revelations continue to emerge 
20101201140032.794|20101201140034.622|TR0|from the massive trove of 
20101201140034.622|20101201140036.450|TR0|diplomatic cables released by 
20101201140036.450|20101201140038.278|TR0|the whisteblower website 
20101201140038.278|20101201140040.105|TR0|WikiLeaks. The latest 
20101201140040.105|20101201140041.933|TR0|disclosures reveal U.S. 
20101201140041.933|20101201140043.761|TR0|officials tried to influence 
20101201140043.761|20101201140045.589|TR0|Spanish prosecutors and 
20101201140045.589|20101201140047.417|TR0|government officials to drop 
20101201140047.417|20101201140049.244|TR0|court investigations into 
20101201140049.244|20101201140051.072|TR0|torture at Guantanamo Bay, CIA 
20101201140051.072|20101201140052.900|TR0|extraordinary rendition flights, 
20101201140052.900|20101201140054.728|TR0|and the 2003 killing of a 
20101201140054.728|20101201140056.556|TR0|Spanish journalist by U.S. 
20101201140056.556|20101201140058.383|TR0|troops in Iraq. The documents 
20101201140058.383|20101201140100.211|TR0|also show the Bush 
20101201140100.211|20101201140102.039|TR0|administration was assured they 
20101201140102.039|20101201140103.867|TR0|would be shielded from scrutiny 
20101201140103.867|20101201140105.695|TR0|at British government inquiry 
20101201140105.695|20101201140107.522|TR0|into the Iraq war. Two months 
20101201140107.522|20101201140109.350|TR0|before the Chilcot inquiry 
20101201140109.350|20101201140111.178|TR0|opened in November 2009, the 
20101201140111.178|20101201140113.006|TR0|U.S. embassy in London reported 
20101201140113.006|20101201140114.834|TR0|that a top British official had 
20101201140114.834|20101201140116.661|TR0|vowed Britain would "put 
20101201140116.661|20101201140118.489|TR0|measures in place to protect 
20101201140118.489|20101201140120.317|TR0|[U.S.] interests" during the 
20101201140120.317|20101201140122.145|TR0|proceedings. The British 
20101201140122.145|20101201140123.973|TR0|official was quoted saying that 
20101201140123.973|20101201140125.800|TR0|while the Iraq war seemed no 
20101201140125.800|20101201140127.628|TR0|longer to be a major issue in 
20101201140127.628|20101201140129.456|TR0|the United States, he predicted 
20101201140129.456|20101201140131.284|TR0|there would be a "feeding 
20101201140131.284|20101201140133.112|TR0|frenzy" once the inquiry began.

20101201140140.423|20101201140142.251|TR0|for WikiLeaks Founder
20101201140142.251|20101201140144.078|TR0|
20101201140144.078|20101201140145.906|TR0|As new revelations emerge, the 
20101201140145.906|20101201140147.734|TR0|international law enforcement 
20101201140147.734|20101201140149.562|TR0|organization Interpol has issued 
20101201140149.562|20101201140151.390|TR0|a global arrest warrant for 
20101201140151.390|20101201140153.217|TR0|WikiLeaks founder Julian 
20101201140153.217|20101201140155.045|TR0|Assange. A Swedish court issued 
20101201140155.045|20101201140156.873|TR0|an arrest warrant for Assange on 
20101201140156.873|20101201140158.701|TR0|charges of rape and sexual 
20101201140158.701|20101201140200.529|TR0|molestation last month after the 
20101201140200.529|20101201140202.356|TR0|prosecutor initially dropped the 
20101201140202.356|20101201140204.184|TR0|case. Assange has denied the 
20101201140204.184|20101201140206.012|TR0|allegations and said he is the 
20101201140206.012|20101201140207.840|TR0|target of a smear campaign. He 
20101201140207.840|20101201140209.668|TR0|is also under investigation in 
20101201140209.668|20101201140211.495|TR0|the United States and could face 
20101201140211.495|20101201140213.323|TR0|charges under the Espionage Act. 
20101201140213.323|20101201140215.151|TR0|Assange's current whereabouts 
20101201140215.151|20101201140216.979|TR0|are unknown.

20101201140229.773|20101201140231.601|TR0|the classified documents to

20101201140304.502|20101201140306.329|TR0|
20101201140306.329|20101201140308.157|TR0|Senate Approves Food Safety Bill
20101201140308.157|20101201140309.985|TR0|
20101201140309.985|20101201140311.813|TR0|The Senate has approved what's 
20101201140311.813|20101201140313.641|TR0|being called the biggest 
20101201140313.641|20101201140315.468|TR0|overhaul of the nation's food 
20101201140315.468|20101201140317.296|TR0|safety system since the 1930s. 
20101201140317.296|20101201140319.124|TR0|In a 73-to-25 vote, the Senate 
20101201140319.124|20101201140320.952|TR0|authorized the expansion of Food 
20101201140320.952|20101201140322.780|TR0|and Drug Administration's 
20101201140322.780|20101201140324.607|TR0|regulatory authority and new 
20101201140324.607|20101201140326.435|TR0|restrictions on farmers and food 
20101201140326.435|20101201140328.263|TR0|companies. The bill allows the 
20101201140328.263|20101201140330.091|TR0|FDA to order recalls, instead of 
20101201140330.091|20101201140331.919|TR0|leaving it up to corporations to 
20101201140331.919|20101201140333.746|TR0|do so voluntarily. The bill also 
20101201140333.746|20101201140335.574|TR0|requires mandatory safety plans, 
20101201140335.574|20101201140337.402|TR0|increases FDA oversight, and 
20101201140337.402|20101201140339.230|TR0|makes it easier to determine the 
20101201140339.230|20101201140341.058|TR0|source of contamination. The 
20101201140341.058|20101201140342.885|TR0|House passed its version of the 
20101201140342.885|20101201140344.713|TR0|measure over a year ago, but it 
20101201140344.713|20101201140346.541|TR0|stalled in the Senate until the 
20101201140346.541|20101201140348.369|TR0|recent salmonella outbreak that 
20101201140348.369|20101201140350.197|TR0|led to the recall of over 500 
20101201140350.197|20101201140352.024|TR0|million eggs. More than a dozen 
20101201140352.024|20101201140353.852|TR0|people have died and thousands 
20101201140353.852|20101201140355.680|TR0|have been sickened in recent 
20101201140355.680|20101201140357.508|TR0|national outbreaks of food-borne 
20101201140357.508|20101201140359.336|TR0|illness. The House version 
20101201140359.336|20101201140401.163|TR0|imposes tougher conditions than 
20101201140401.163|20101201140402.991|TR0|the Senate's, but House leaders 
20101201140402.991|20101201140404.819|TR0|say they will likely accept the 
20101201140404.819|20101201140406.647|TR0|Senate version to avoid a 
20101201140406.647|20101201140408.475|TR0|lengthy conference process.
20101201140408.475|20101201140410.302|TR0|

20101201140421.269|20101201140423.097|TR0|repeal of the "Don't Ask, Don't 
20101201140423.097|20101201140424.925|TR0|Tell" policy that bars openly 
20101201140424.925|20101201140426.753|TR0|gay men and lesbians from 
20101201140426.753|20101201140428.580|TR0|serving in the military. On 
20101201140428.580|20101201140430.408|TR0|Tuesday, the Pentagon released a 
20101201140430.408|20101201140432.236|TR0|long-awaited study that shows 
20101201140432.236|20101201140434.064|TR0|more than 70 percent of 
20101201140434.064|20101201140435.892|TR0|servicemembers believe lifting 
20101201140435.892|20101201140437.719|TR0|the ban would have "positive, 
20101201140437.719|20101201140439.547|TR0|mixed or no results." U.S. 
20101201140439.547|20101201140441.375|TR0|Defense Secretary Robert Gates 
20101201140441.375|20101201140443.203|TR0|said Congress should repeal the 
20101201140443.203|20101201140445.031|TR0|law before the end of the year, 
20101201140445.031|20101201140446.858|TR0|but then added that the military 
20101201140446.858|20101201140448.686|TR0|needs an unspecified amount of 
20101201140448.686|20101201140450.514|TR0|time to "prepare."
20101201140450.514|20101201140452.342|TR0|
20101201140452.342|20101201140454.170|TR0|Defense Secretary Robert Gates: 
20101201140454.170|20101201140455.997|TR0|"In my view, the concerns of 
20101201140455.997|20101201140457.825|TR0|combat troops as expressed in 
20101201140457.825|20101201140459.653|TR0|the survey do not present an 
20101201140459.653|20101201140501.481|TR0|insurmountable barrier to 
20101201140501.481|20101201140503.309|TR0|successful repeal of 'Don't Ask, 
20101201140503.309|20101201140505.136|TR0|Don't Tell.' This can be done, 
20101201140505.136|20101201140506.964|TR0|and should be done, without 
20101201140506.964|20101201140508.792|TR0|posing a serious risk to 
20101201140508.792|20101201140510.620|TR0|military readiness. However, 
20101201140510.620|20101201140512.448|TR0|these findings do lead me to 
20101201140512.448|20101201140514.275|TR0|conclude that an abundance of 
20101201140514.275|20101201140516.103|TR0|care and preparation is required 
20101201140516.103|20101201140517.931|TR0|if we are to avoid a disruptive 
20101201140517.931|20101201140519.759|TR0|-- and potentially dangerous -- 
20101201140519.759|20101201140521.587|TR0|impact on the performance of 
20101201140521.587|20101201140523.414|TR0|those serving at the tip of the 
20101201140523.414|20101201140525.242|TR0|spear in America's wars."

20101201140638.354|20101201140640.182|TR0|for U.S. households earning over 
20101201140640.182|20101201140642.010|TR0|$250,000. The Obama 
20101201140642.010|20101201140643.838|TR0|administration has signaled it 
20101201140643.838|20101201140645.665|TR0|is willing to compromise to 
20101201140645.665|20101201140647.493|TR0|extend the cuts. The meeting 
20101201140647.493|20101201140649.321|TR0|also covered the stalled nuclear 
20101201140649.321|20101201140651.149|TR0|arms reduction treaty with 
20101201140651.149|20101201140652.977|TR0|Russia, the extension of 
20101201140652.977|20101201140654.804|TR0|unemployment benefits, and the 
20101201140654.804|20101201140656.632|TR0|funding of government 
20101201140656.632|20101201140658.460|TR0|operations. Obama hailed the 
20101201140658.460|20101201140700.288|TR0|talks as a sign of bipartisan 
20101201140700.288|20101201140702.116|TR0|cooperation.

20101201140703.943|20101201140705.771|TR0|President Obama: "I think 
20101201140705.771|20101201140707.599|TR0|everybody understands that the 
20101201140707.599|20101201140709.427|TR0|American people want us to focus 
20101201140709.427|20101201140711.255|TR0|on their jobs, not ours. They 
20101201140711.255|20101201140713.082|TR0|want us to come together around 
20101201140713.082|20101201140714.910|TR0|strategies to accelerate the 
20101201140714.910|20101201140716.738|TR0|recovery and get Americans back 
20101201140716.738|20101201140718.566|TR0|to work. They want us to 
20101201140718.566|20101201140720.394|TR0|confront the long-term deficits 
20101201140720.394|20101201140722.221|TR0|that cloud our future. They want 
20101201140722.221|20101201140724.049|TR0|us to focus on their safety and 
20101201140724.049|20101201140725.877|TR0|security and not allow matters 
20101201140725.877|20101201140727.705|TR0|of urgent importance to become 
20101201140727.705|20101201140729.533|TR0|locked up in the politics of

20101201140800.605|20101201140802.433|TR0|reducing the deficit has delayed 
20101201140802.433|20101201140804.261|TR0|a final vote on a package of 
20101201140804.261|20101201140806.089|TR0|recommendations that includes 
20101201140806.089|20101201140807.916|TR0|widespread cuts to Social 
20101201140807.916|20101201140809.744|TR0|Security and Medicare. Panel 
20101201140809.744|20101201140811.572|TR0|co-chairs Erskine Bowles and 
20101201140811.572|20101201140813.400|TR0|Alan Simpson have proposed 
20101201140813.400|20101201140815.228|TR0|raising the retirement age for 
20101201140815.228|20101201140817.055|TR0|Social Security to 69 by 2075, 
20101201140817.055|20101201140818.883|TR0|decreasing the cost of living 
20101201140818.883|20101201140820.711|TR0|benefits for Social Security 
20101201140820.711|20101201140822.539|TR0|recipients, imposing new limits 
20101201140822.539|20101201140824.367|TR0|on the Medicare health insurance 
20101201140824.367|20101201140826.194|TR0|program, ending several 
20101201140826.194|20101201140828.022|TR0|middle-class tax breaks, and 
20101201140828.022|20101201140829.850|TR0|reducing corporate income taxes.

20101201140833.506|20101201140835.333|TR0|because they have been unable to

20101201141604.972|20101201141606.800|TR0|>> SCOTT HORTON: Well, Khaled 
20101201141606.800|20101201141608.628|TR0|El-Masri was a green grocer from 
20101201141608.628|20101201141610.456|TR0|small town in south Germany. And 
20101201141610.456|20101201141612.283|TR0|in around New Year's 2003, he 
20101201141612.283|20101201141614.111|TR0|made a bus trip down to 
20101201141614.111|20101201141615.939|TR0|Macedonia after having a spat 
20101201141615.939|20101201141617.767|TR0|with his wife. He was 
20101201141617.767|20101201141619.595|TR0|apprehended by border agents 
20101201141619.595|20101201141621.422|TR0|there, and they noticed his 
20101201141621.422|20101201141623.250|TR0|passport, his name, was almost, 
20101201141623.250|20101201141625.078|TR0|but for two letters, the same as 
20101201141625.078|20101201141626.906|TR0|one of the most wanted al-Qaeda 
20101201141626.906|20101201141628.734|TR0|agents, who had in fact been 
20101201141628.734|20101201141630.561|TR0|operating in Germany, also named 
20101201141630.561|20101201141632.389|TR0|Khalid al-Masri. And they 
20101201141632.389|20101201141634.217|TR0|brought this to the attention of 
20101201141634.217|20101201141636.045|TR0|the CIA. The CIA concluded very 
20101201141636.045|20101201141637.873|TR0|quickly that they had their man. 
20101201141637.873|20101201141639.700|TR0|They arrested him, and after he 
20101201141639.700|20101201141641.528|TR0|was interrogated for a few days, 
20101201141641.528|20101201141643.356|TR0|he was shipped off to - first to 
20101201141643.356|20101201141645.184|TR0|Baghdad and then to Afghanistan. 
20101201141645.184|20101201141647.012|TR0|He recounts he was beaten, he 
20101201141647.012|20101201141648.839|TR0|was shot up with drugs. He was 
20101201141648.839|20101201141650.667|TR0|beaten repeatedly, and he was 
20101201141650.667|20101201141652.495|TR0|interrogated. Throughout, he 
20101201141652.495|20101201141654.323|TR0|insisted that, "No, I'm a grocer 
20101201141654.323|20101201141656.151|TR0|from south Germany, and my 
20101201141656.151|20101201141657.978|TR0|passport's correct, and there's 
20101201141657.978|20101201141659.806|TR0|nothing wrong."
20101201141659.806|20101201141701.634|TR0|
20101201141701.634|20101201141703.462|TR0|Well, after several months, the 
20101201141703.462|20101201141705.290|TR0|CIA concluded that indeed he was 
20101201141705.290|20101201141707.117|TR0|exactly who he said he was, not 
20101201141707.117|20101201141708.945|TR0|the person that they thought 
20101201141708.945|20101201141710.773|TR0|they had apprehended. Then a 
20101201141710.773|20101201141712.601|TR0|controversy broke out within the 
20101201141712.601|20101201141714.429|TR0|CIA about what to do with him, a

20101201141716.256|20101201141718.084|TR0|evidently saying, "This man 
20101201141718.084|20101201141719.912|TR0|knows too much. We can't turn 
20101201141719.912|20101201141721.740|TR0|him free." But evidently, 
20101201141721.740|20101201141723.568|TR0|Condoleezza Rice, in the end, 
20101201141723.568|20101201141725.395|TR0|intervened and ordered that he 
20101201141725.395|20101201141727.223|TR0|be released, and he was 
20101201141727.223|20101201141729.051|TR0|released. Now, the jet that flew 
20101201141729.051|20101201141730.879|TR0|him -
20101201141730.879|20101201141732.707|TR0|
20101201141732.707|20101201141734.534|TR0|>> AMY GOODMAN: But for a period 
20101201141734.534|20101201141736.362|TR0|of time, the top officials knew 
20101201141736.362|20101201141738.190|TR0|they had the wrong man, and they 
20101201141738.190|20101201141740.018|TR0|kept him.

20101201142611.802|20101201142613.630|TR0|ascertain who had been involved 
20101201142613.630|20101201142615.457|TR0|in the snatch, and they 
20101201142615.457|20101201142617.285|TR0|identified 13 CIA agents who had 
20101201142617.285|20101201142619.113|TR0|been involved. They were 
20101201142619.113|20101201142620.941|TR0|collecting information in 
20101201142620.941|20101201142622.769|TR0|coordination with the Spanish 
20101201142622.769|20101201142624.596|TR0|investigators, who looked at 
20101201142624.596|20101201142626.424|TR0|what had gone on in Spain, where 
20101201142626.424|20101201142628.252|TR0|13 CIA agents had entered using 
20101201142628.252|20101201142630.080|TR0|false identifications and had 
20101201142630.080|20101201142631.908|TR0|launched this effort from Palma 
20101201142631.908|20101201142633.735|TR0|de Majorca. And they issued 
20101201142633.735|20101201142635.563|TR0|arrest warrants for the 13 
20101201142635.563|20101201142637.391|TR0|agents.
20101201142637.391|20101201142639.219|TR0|

20101201142644.702|20101201142646.530|TR0|minister, was in Washington, met

20101201143159.084|20101201143200.912|TR0|source when information is

20101201143202.739|20101201143204.567|TR0|thing for a journalist. Not in 
20101201143204.567|20101201143206.395|TR0|this case, however. These are 
20101201143206.395|20101201143208.223|TR0|Department of State cables.

20101201143210.051|20101201143211.878|TR0|or their validity. And so, the 
20101201143211.878|20101201143213.706|TR0|credibility of Julian Assange is

20101201143219.190|20101201143221.017|TR0|distract us from looking at the

20101201143222.845|20101201143224.673|TR0|

20101201143226.501|20101201143228.329|TR0|Congressman King's call is 
20101201143228.329|20101201143230.156|TR0|simply absurd. U.S. legislation 
20101201143230.156|20101201143231.984|TR0|defines what a foreign terrorist 
20101201143231.984|20101201143233.812|TR0|organization is, and it says 
20101201143233.812|20101201143235.640|TR0|it's an organization that is 
20101201143235.640|20101201143237.468|TR0|engaged in multiple politically 
20101201143237.468|20101201143239.295|TR0|motivated acts of violence. So

20101201143241.123|20101201143242.951|TR0|foreign terrorist organization, 
20101201143242.951|20101201143244.779|TR0|you would be making a nonsense 
20101201143244.779|20101201143246.607|TR0|out of our own statute. You 
20101201143246.607|20101201143248.434|TR0|would be highly politicizing it.
20101201143248.434|20101201143250.262|TR0|
20101201143250.262|20101201143252.090|TR0|I think, here, the U.S. 
20101201143252.090|20101201143253.918|TR0|government does have a basis to 
20101201143253.918|20101201143255.746|TR0|bring criminal claims against 
20101201143255.746|20101201143257.573|TR0|persons who disclose this

20101201143319.507|20101201143321.335|TR0|>> AMY GOODMAN: And the former

20101201143330.474|20101201143332.302|TR0|>> SCOTT HORTON: Well, and using 
20101201143332.302|20101201143334.129|TR0|the word "treason." And I think 
20101201143334.129|20101201143335.957|TR0|you've got to just stop and 
20101201143335.957|20101201143337.785|TR0|think. Treason is a highly 
20101201143337.785|20101201143339.613|TR0|disfavored crime under U.S. law. 
20101201143339.613|20101201143341.441|TR0|It was highly disfavored by the 
20101201143341.441|20101201143343.268|TR0|founders of this country. And 
20101201143343.268|20101201143345.096|TR0|there's a good reason for that, 
20101201143345.096|20101201143346.924|TR0|because the founders of our 
20101201143346.924|20101201143348.752|TR0|country committed treason. So, 
20101201143348.752|20101201143350.580|TR0|therefore, they don't like the 
20101201143350.580|20101201143352.407|TR0|charge of treason. They defined 
20101201143352.407|20101201143354.235|TR0|it in the Constitution itself, 
20101201143354.235|20101201143356.063|TR0|and they made it almost 
20101201143356.063|20101201143357.891|TR0|impossible to charge and try. I 
20101201143357.891|20101201143359.719|TR0|think professional prosecutors 
20101201143359.719|20101201143401.546|TR0|will have far sounder - I mean, 
20101201143401.546|20101201143403.374|TR0|he's going for sound bites, 
20101201143403.374|20101201143405.202|TR0|obviously, not really studying 
20101201143405.202|20101201143407.030|TR0|the law. A professional 
20101201143407.030|20101201143408.858|TR0|prosecutor will have a far 
20101201143408.858|20101201143410.685|TR0|sounder basis for formulating 
20101201143410.685|20101201143412.513|TR0|charges and going forward. But 
20101201143412.513|20101201143414.341|TR0|the death penalty, I just don't 
20101201143414.341|20101201143416.169|TR0|see. In the case of nuclear 
20101201143416.169|20101201143417.997|TR0|secrets being disclosed or other 
20101201143417.997|20101201143419.824|TR0|maybe signals intelligence, 
20101201143419.824|20101201143421.652|TR0|certain things like that, 
20101201143421.652|20101201143423.480|TR0|there's a possibility in those 
20101201143423.480|20101201143425.308|TR0|cases for an extreme charge and 
20101201143425.308|20101201143427.136|TR0|an extreme penalty, but not in 
20101201143427.136|20101201143428.963|TR0|this case, I think. Frankly, 
20101201143428.963|20101201143430.791|TR0|there hasn't been any severe 
20101201143430.791|20101201143432.619|TR0|harm. People have been 
20101201143432.619|20101201143434.447|TR0|embarrassed by what's going on, 
20101201143434.447|20101201143436.275|TR0|but there's been no real severe 
20101201143436.275|20101201143438.102|TR0|harm to U.S. interests. And most 
20101201143438.102|20101201143439.930|TR0|of the things we discovered are 
20101201143439.930|20101201143441.758|TR0|things that most people who were 
20101201143441.758|20101201143443.586|TR0|closely following the situation 
20101201143443.586|20101201143445.414|TR0|long suspected anyway.
20101201143445.414|20101201143447.241|TR0|
20101201143447.241|20101201143449.069|TR0|>> AMY GOODMAN: WikiLeaks 
20101201143449.069|20101201143450.897|TR0|founder Julian Assange did speak 
20101201143450.897|20101201143452.725|TR0|to Time Magazine from an 
20101201143452.725|20101201143454.553|TR0|undisclosed location on Tuesday.

20101201144320.853|20101201144322.681|TR0|filming their own deaths, as the 
20101201144322.681|20101201144324.509|TR0|U.S. tank opened fire on the 
20101201144324.509|20101201144326.337|TR0|Palestine Hotel. That's an 
20101201144326.337|20101201144328.164|TR0|excerpt of the documentary Hotel 
20101201144328.164|20101201144329.992|TR0|Palestine: Killing the Witness, 
20101201144329.992|20101201144331.820|TR0|produced by Jose Couso's own 
20101201144331.820|20101201144333.648|TR0|network in Spain called 
20101201144333.648|20101201144335.476|TR0|Telecinco.
20101201144335.476|20101201144337.303|TR0|
20101201144337.303|20101201144339.131|TR0|Well, I interviewed one of the 
20101201144339.131|20101201144340.959|TR0|many Spanish journalists who 
20101201144340.959|20101201144342.787|TR0|witnessed the attack on the 
20101201144342.787|20101201144344.615|TR0|Palestine Hotel in Baghdad, 
20101201144344.615|20101201144346.442|TR0|April 8th, 2003. Olga 
20101201144346.442|20101201144348.270|TR0|[Rodriguez], a correspondent for 
20101201144348.270|20101201144350.098|TR0|one of the leading radio 
20101201144350.098|20101201144351.926|TR0|networks in Spain, narrowly 
20101201144351.926|20101201144353.754|TR0|survived the attack herself. I 
20101201144353.754|20101201144355.581|TR0|spoke to her five years ago, 
20101201144355.581|20101201144357.409|TR0|when she came here to New York.
20101201144357.409|20101201144359.237|TR0|
20101201144359.237|20101201144401.065|TR0|>> OLGA RODRIGUEZ: We were in 
20101201144401.065|20101201144402.893|TR0|the balcony. We were living in 
20101201144402.893|20101201144404.720|TR0|that hotel, approximately 200 
20101201144404.720|20101201144406.548|TR0|journalists, Europeans, American 
20101201144406.548|20101201144408.376|TR0|journalists. And that day before 
20101201144408.376|20101201144410.204|TR0|the attack, we said even hello 
20101201144410.204|20101201144412.032|TR0|to the troops. They were in the 
20101201144412.032|20101201144413.859|TR0|other side of the river, Tigris 
20101201144413.859|20101201144415.687|TR0|River, and they were there 
20101201144415.687|20101201144417.515|TR0|looking around as military 
20101201144417.515|20101201144419.343|TR0|people. They were trying to know 
20101201144419.343|20101201144421.171|TR0|what - which buildings were 
20101201144421.171|20101201144422.998|TR0|surrounding them, and that was 
20101201144422.998|20101201144424.826|TR0|the day before.
20101201144424.826|20101201144426.654|TR0|
20101201144426.654|20101201144428.482|TR0|The 8th of April, we woke up 
20101201144428.482|20101201144430.310|TR0|early in the morning, and we saw 
20101201144430.310|20101201144432.137|TR0|some tanks already on the 
20101201144432.137|20101201144433.965|TR0|bridge. They were not hiding. 
20101201144433.965|20101201144435.793|TR0|They were there. When the attack 
20101201144435.793|20101201144437.621|TR0|happened, I saw them the first 
20101201144437.621|20101201144439.449|TR0|time like four hours before the 
20101201144439.449|20101201144441.276|TR0|attack on the bridge. And I was 
20101201144441.276|20101201144443.104|TR0|in the 16th floor of Palestine 
20101201144443.104|20101201144444.932|TR0|Hotel, and I was waiting for a 
20101201144444.932|20101201144446.760|TR0|phone call from my radio station 
20101201144446.760|20101201144448.588|TR0|in Spain, because I had to be on 
20101201144448.588|20101201144450.415|TR0|the air, and I was on the 
20101201144450.415|20101201144452.243|TR0|balcony. Suddenly, my phone 
20101201144452.243|20101201144454.071|TR0|rang, so I went inside the room. 
20101201144454.071|20101201144455.899|TR0|And when I was doing that, the 
20101201144455.899|20101201144457.727|TR0|attack came.
20101201144457.727|20101201144459.554|TR0|
20101201144459.554|20101201144501.382|TR0|At first, I thought that I was 
20101201144501.382|20101201144503.210|TR0|dead. I felt completely empty 
20101201144503.210|20101201144505.038|TR0|inside me. I couldn't hear 
20101201144505.038|20101201144506.866|TR0|anything. Then five seconds 
20101201144506.866|20101201144508.693|TR0|later, I reacted. I started to 
20101201144508.693|20101201144510.521|TR0|touch myself. I discovered some 
20101201144510.521|20101201144512.349|TR0|blood in my leg, and I decided 
20101201144512.349|20101201144514.177|TR0|to run. I went to the other room 
20101201144514.177|20101201144516.005|TR0|where some Spanish journalists 
20101201144516.005|20101201144517.832|TR0|were, and I said, "I cannot hear 
20101201144517.832|20101201144519.660|TR0|anything. We have been 
20101201144519.660|20101201144521.488|TR0|attacked." And after that, we 
20101201144521.488|20101201144523.316|TR0|went stairs down. When we 
20101201144523.316|20101201144525.144|TR0|arrived to the 14th floor, where 
20101201144525.144|20101201144526.971|TR0|Jose -
20101201144526.971|20101201144528.799|TR0|

20101201145158.121|20101201145159.948|TR0|tax cuts would amount to more

20101201145201.776|20101201145203.604|TR0|and TARP and Afghan and Iraq 
20101201145203.604|20101201145205.432|TR0|combined - almost a trillion 
20101201145205.432|20101201145207.260|TR0|dollars in ten years. So you 
20101201145207.260|20101201145209.087|TR0|could say we're in a hole 
20101201145209.087|20101201145210.915|TR0|looking for a shovel rather than 
20101201145210.915|20101201145212.743|TR0|a rope. In the meantime, they're 
20101201145212.743|20101201145214.571|TR0|not discussing a poverty cut. 
20101201145214.571|20101201145216.399|TR0|Now 59 million Americans have no 
20101201145216.399|20101201145218.226|TR0|health insurance; that number is 
20101201145218.226|20101201145220.054|TR0|rising. Forty-nine million are 
20101201145220.054|20101201145221.882|TR0|now in poverty. The highest food 
20101201145221.882|20101201145223.710|TR0|stamp allocation, 41 million, 
20101201145223.710|20101201145225.538|TR0|ever. And so, while the 
20101201145225.538|20101201145227.365|TR0|subsidized wealthy are splurging 
20101201145227.365|20101201145229.193|TR0|in their wealth, because they 
20101201145229.193|20101201145231.021|TR0|were subsidized, there is a 
20101201145231.021|20101201145232.849|TR0|growing body of unemployed 
20101201145232.849|20101201145234.677|TR0|people. And these two million 
20101201145234.677|20101201145236.504|TR0|Americans cannot get 
20101201145236.504|20101201145238.332|TR0|unemployment benefits. They 
20101201145238.332|20101201145240.160|TR0|cannot pay their house notes.

20101201145241.988|20101201145243.816|TR0|in school. And so, we must use a 
20101201145243.816|20101201145245.643|TR0|rope to climb this hole, not 
20101201145245.643|20101201145247.471|TR0|another shovel.

20101201145553.907|20101201145555.735|TR0|people. And they come at night,
